definition[0]: the total pay and benefits that a particular employee or group of employees receives
example[0]: An increasing proportion of the company’s employee compensation is paid in stock.
definition[1]: money paid to an employee by an employer’s insurers because the employee has been harmed in some way, for example in an accident at work
example[1]: Because of the limitations of employee compensation policies, more people are turning to the courts to seek additional disability awards.
